breakfast.name: Oatmeal with Berries
breakfast.description: A warm bowl of rolled oats topped with mixed berries and a sprinkle of chia seeds.
preparation: Bring water or milk to a boil in a small saucepan.
Stir in oats and reduce heat to low.
Simmer for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until oats are tender.
Pour into a bowl and top with mixed berries and chia seeds.

midMorningSnack.name: Greek Yogurt
midMorningSnack.description: A serving of plain Greek yogurt with a drizzle of honey.
preparation: Spoon the Greek yogurt into a bowl.
Drizzle with honey if desired and serve.

lunch.name: Grilled Chicken Salad
lunch.description: Grilled chicken breast over a bed of mixed greens, tomatoes, cucumbers, and a light vinaigrette.
preparation: Season and grill the chicken breast until cooked through, then slice.
Combine mixed greens, cucumber, and tomato in a large bowl.
Top with the sliced grilled chicken and drizzle with vinaigrette.

afternoonSnack.name: Apple with Peanut Butter
afternoonSnack.description: A crisp apple with two tablespoons of natural peanut butter.
preparation: Slice the apple.
Serve with peanut butter for dipping.

dinner.name: Baked Salmon with Quinoa
dinner.description: Baked salmon fillet served with a side of quinoa and steamed asparagus.
preparation: Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F).
Toss asparagus with olive oil and season.
Place salmon and asparagus on a baking sheet and bake for 12-15 minutes.
Serve with quinoa and a squeeze of lemon over the salmon.

None.nutritionistTip: Hydration is key! Aim to drink at least 8-10 glasses of water throughout the day to stay hydrated.

breakfast.name: Protein Oatmeal
breakfast.description: Oats cooked with a scoop of protein powder, topped with banana slices.
ingredients: 1 scoop vanilla or chocolate protein powder
preparation: Cook oats with liquid as usual.
Once cooked, stir in the protein powder until fully combined.
Top with banana slices and serve immediately.

midMorningSnack.name: Hard-Boiled Eggs
midMorningSnack.description: Two hard-boiled eggs for a protein-packed snack.
preparation: Place eggs in a saucepan and cover with cold water.
Bring to a boil, then cover and remove from heat.
Let stand for 10-12 minutes.
Drain and cool in ice water before peeling.

lunch.name: Chicken Breast & Sweet Potato
lunch.description: Grilled chicken breast with a baked sweet potato and a side of broccoli.
preparation: Bake the sweet potato at 200°C (400°F) for 45-50 minutes.
Grill or pan-sear the chicken breast until cooked through.
Steam the broccoli until tender-crisp.
Serve all components together.

afternoonSnack.name: Cottage Cheese
afternoonSnack.description: A cup of low-fat cottage cheese with pineapple chunks.
preparation: Combine cottage cheese and pineapple in a bowl.

dinner.name: Lean Beef with Brown Rice
dinner.description: Lean ground beef with brown rice and mixed vegetables.
ingredients: 1 cup mixed vegetables (e.g., peas, carrots, corn)
preparation: Cook ground beef in a skillet until browned, drain any excess fat.
Stir in the mixed vegetables and cook until heated through.
Serve the beef and vegetable mixture over the brown rice.

None.nutritionistTip: Protein timing is crucial for sprinters. Consume a protein-rich snack or meal within an hour after your training session to maximize muscle repair.

breakfast.name: Protein Oatmeal
breakfast.description: Oats cooked with a scoop of plant-based protein powder, topped with banana slices.
ingredients: 1 scoop vanilla or chocolate plant-based protein powder
preparation: Cook oats with liquid as usual.
Once cooked, stir in the protein powder until fully combined.
Top with banana slices and serve immediately.

midMorningSnack.name: Greek Yogurt
midMorningSnack.description: A serving of plain Greek yogurt for a protein-packed snack.
preparation: Serve yogurt in a bowl. Can be topped with berries.

lunch.name: Tofu Scramble & Sweet Potato
lunch.description: Scrambled tofu with spices, a baked sweet potato, and a side of broccoli.
preparation: Bake the sweet potato at 200°C (400°F) for 45-50 minutes.
Sauté crumbled tofu with turmeric and cumin until heated through.
Steam the broccoli until tender-crisp.
Serve all components together.

afternoonSnack.name: Cottage Cheese
afternoonSnack.description: A cup of low-fat cottage cheese with pineapple chunks.
preparation: Combine cottage cheese and pineapple in a bowl.

dinner.name: Lentil Bolognese with Brown Rice
dinner.description: A rich lentil and vegetable bolognese sauce served over brown rice.
preparation: Sauté onion and carrot until soft.
Add crushed tomatoes and cooked lentils. Simmer for 15 minutes.
Serve the lentil bolognese over the brown rice.

Vegetarian.nutritionistTip: Ensure you're getting complete proteins by combining sources like beans and rice. Plant-based protein is excellent for muscle repair.

breakfast.name: Large Bowl of Oatmeal
breakfast.description: A large bowl of oatmeal with banana, walnuts, and a drizzle of maple syrup.
preparation: Cook oats according to package directions.
Pour into a large bowl and top with banana, walnuts, and a drizzle of maple syrup.

midMorningSnack.name: Fruit Smoothie
midMorningSnack.description: A smoothie with mixed berries, Greek yogurt, and a touch of honey.
preparation: Combine all ingredients in a blender.
Blend until smooth.

lunch.name: Pasta with Chicken
lunch.description: A generous portion of whole-wheat pasta with grilled chicken and tomato sauce.
preparation: Cook pasta according to package directions.
Heat tomato sauce in a saucepan.
Combine cooked pasta, chicken, and sauce in a large bowl and toss.

afternoonSnack.name: Rice Cakes with Avocado
afternoonSnack.description: Two brown rice cakes topped with mashed avocado and a sprinkle of salt.
preparation: Mash the avocado and spread it evenly over the rice cakes.
Sprinkle with salt and serve.

dinner.name: Salmon, Rice, and Veggies
dinner.description: A large fillet of salmon with a hefty side of white rice and steamed green beans.
preparation: Season and bake or pan-sear the salmon until cooked through.
Steam the green beans until tender.
Serve the salmon with the rice and green beans.

None.nutritionistTip: Carbohydrates are your primary fuel source. Focus on complex carbs throughout the day to keep your glycogen stores full for long runs.

breakfast.name: Large Bowl of Oatmeal
breakfast.description: A large bowl of oatmeal with banana, walnuts, and a drizzle of maple syrup.
preparation: Cook oats according to package directions.
Pour into a large bowl and top with banana, walnuts, and a drizzle of maple syrup.

midMorningSnack.name: Fruit Smoothie
midMorningSnack.description: A smoothie with mixed berries, soy yogurt, and a touch of honey.
preparation: Combine all ingredients in a blender.
Blend until smooth.

lunch.name: Pasta with Lentil Sauce
lunch.description: A generous portion of whole-wheat pasta with a hearty red lentil tomato sauce.
preparation: Cook pasta according to package directions.
Sauté onion, then add lentils and tomato sauce and simmer until lentils are soft.
Combine cooked pasta and sauce in a large bowl and toss.

afternoonSnack.name: Rice Cakes with Avocado
afternoonSnack.description: Two brown rice cakes topped with mashed avocado and a sprinkle of salt.
preparation: Mash the avocado and spread it evenly over the rice cakes.
Sprinkle with salt and serve.

dinner.name: Tofu, Rice, and Veggies
dinner.description: A large portion of baked tofu with a hefty side of white rice and steamed green beans.
preparation: Bake tofu at 200°C (400°F) for 20-25 minutes until golden.
Steam the green beans until tender.
Serve the tofu with the rice and green beans.

Vegetarian.nutritionistTip: Plant-based carbohydrates are your best friend! Focus on sources like sweet potatoes, oats, and whole grains to fuel your long runs and aid recovery.
